trans-unit.source: How to use Table storage from Python | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use Table storage from Python | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how you can use the Table service from Python to create and delete a table, and to insert and query a table.
trans-unit.target: Learn how you can use the Table service from Python to create and delete a table, and to insert and query a table.

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios by using the Azure Table storage service.
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to perform common scenarios by using the Azure Table storage service.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in Python and use the <linkText>Python Azure Storage package</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in Python and use the <linkText>Python Azure Storage package</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The covered scenarios include creating and deleting a table, in addition to inserting and querying entities in a table.
trans-unit.target: The covered scenarios include creating and deleting a table, in addition to inserting and querying entities in a table.

trans-unit.source: If you need to install Python or the <linkText>Python Azure package</linkText><title></title>, see the <linkText>Python installation guide</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you need to install Python or the <linkText>Python Azure package</linkText><title></title>, see the <linkText>Python installation guide</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The TableService object lets you work with table services.
trans-unit.target: The TableService object lets you work with table services.

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a TableService object.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a TableService object.

trans-unit.source: Add the code near the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:
trans-unit.target: Add the code near the top of any Python file in which you wish to programmatically access Azure Storage:

trans-unit.source: The following code creates a TableService object by using the storage account name and account key.
trans-unit.target: The following code creates a TableService object by using the storage account name and account key.

trans-unit.source: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.
trans-unit.target: Replace 'myaccount' and 'mykey' with the real account and key.

trans-unit.source: To add an entity, first create a dictionary that defines your entity property names and values.
trans-unit.target: To add an entity, first create a dictionary that defines your entity property names and values.

trans-unit.source: Note that for every entity, you must specify PartitionKey and RowKey.
trans-unit.target: Note that for every entity, you must specify PartitionKey and RowKey.

trans-unit.source: These are the unique identifiers of your entities.
trans-unit.target: These are the unique identifiers of your entities.

trans-unit.source: You can query these values much faster than you can query your other properties.
trans-unit.target: You can query these values much faster than you can query your other properties.

trans-unit.source: The system uses PartitionKey to automatically distribute the table entities over many storage nodes.
trans-unit.target: The system uses PartitionKey to automatically distribute the table entities over many storage nodes.

trans-unit.source: Entities that have the same PartitionKey are stored on the same node.
trans-unit.target: Entities that have the same PartitionKey are stored on the same node.

trans-unit.source: RowKey is the unique ID of the entity within the partition that it belongs to.
trans-unit.target: RowKey is the unique ID of the entity within the partition that it belongs to.

trans-unit.source: To add an entity to your table, pass a dictionary object to the insert\_entity method.
trans-unit.target: To add an entity to your table, pass a dictionary object to the insert\_entity method.

trans-unit.source: You can also pass an instance of the Entity class to the insert\_entity method.
trans-unit.target: You can also pass an instance of the Entity class to the insert\_entity method.

trans-unit.source: This code shows how to replace the old version of an existing entity with an updated version.
trans-unit.target: This code shows how to replace the old version of an existing entity with an updated version.

trans-unit.source: If the entity that is being updated does not exist, then the update operation will fail.
trans-unit.target: If the entity that is being updated does not exist, then the update operation will fail.

trans-unit.source: If you want to store an entity regardless of whether it existed before, use insert\_or\_replace_entity.
trans-unit.target: If you want to store an entity regardless of whether it existed before, use insert\_or\_replace_entity.

trans-unit.source: In the following example, the first call will replace the existing entity.
trans-unit.target: In the following example, the first call will replace the existing entity.

trans-unit.source: The second call will insert a new entity, since no entity with the specified PartitionKey and RowKey exists in the table.
trans-unit.target: The second call will insert a new entity, since no entity with the specified PartitionKey and RowKey exists in the table.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes it makes sense to submit multiple operations together in a batch to ensure atomic processing by the server.
trans-unit.target: Sometimes it makes sense to submit multiple operations together in a batch to ensure atomic processing by the server.

trans-unit.source: To accomplish that, you use the begin\_batch method on TableService and then call the series of operations as usual.
trans-unit.target: To accomplish that, you use the begin\_batch method on TableService and then call the series of operations as usual.

trans-unit.source: When you do want to submit the batch, you call commit\_batch.
trans-unit.target: When you do want to submit the batch, you call commit\_batch.

trans-unit.source: Note that all entities must be in the same partition in order to be changed as a batch.
trans-unit.target: Note that all entities must be in the same partition in order to be changed as a batch.

trans-unit.source: The example below adds two entities together in a batch.
trans-unit.target: The example below adds two entities together in a batch.

trans-unit.source: To query an entity in a table, use the get\_entity method by passing PartitionKey and RowKey.
trans-unit.target: To query an entity in a table, use the get\_entity method by passing PartitionKey and RowKey.

trans-unit.source: This example finds all tasks in Seattle based on PartitionKey.
trans-unit.target: This example finds all tasks in Seattle based on PartitionKey.

trans-unit.source: A query to a table can retrieve just a few properties from an entity.
trans-unit.target: A query to a table can retrieve just a few properties from an entity.

trans-unit.source: This technique, called projection, reduces bandwidth and can improve query performance, especially for large entities.
trans-unit.target: This technique, called projection, reduces bandwidth and can improve query performance, especially for large entities.

trans-unit.source: Use the select parameter and pass the names of the properties that you want to bring over to the client.
trans-unit.target: Use the select parameter and pass the names of the properties that you want to bring over to the client.

trans-unit.source: The query in the following code returns only the descriptions of entities in the table.
trans-unit.target: The query in the following code returns only the descriptions of entities in the table.

trans-unit.source: The following snippet works only against the cloud storage service.
trans-unit.target: The following snippet works only against the cloud storage service.

trans-unit.source: This is not supported by the storage emulator.
trans-unit.target: This is not supported by the storage emulator.

trans-unit.source: You can delete an entity by using its partition and row key.
trans-unit.target: You can delete an entity by using its partition and row key.

trans-unit.source: The following code deletes a table from a storage account.
trans-unit.target: The following code deletes a table from a storage account.
